results.title: Northern fisherman
results.creator_credit: Martin Defalco, George Pearson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A film about the life of an Indian fisherman of the prairie provinces. For commercial fishermen the film shows simple but effective sanitary measures to protect the freshness and attractiveness of freshwater catches. For general audiences, there is a view of Indian life and enterprise. The commentary is spoken by the fisherman as he goes about his work. He recalls his boyhood when the men of his band freighted by canoe for the Hudson’s Bay Company. But he talks about much more than fishing and hunting. He speaks of education, of sickness and health, of family, of poverty, of the pleasures of a Saturday night dance, and he demonstrates the tricks of his own trade - when to set a net, how to handle fish, and what it all costs in money, time, equipment and skill.

results.title: Northern composition = Airs du nord
results.creator_credit: Bruce Mackay, Gary Toole and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Image and music work together—either by contrast or analogy—to conjure up the look of Canada. Moods and activities; far-ranging landscapes; a bird’s-eye view of great industrial complexes: all this and much more are fitted into a compelling visual composition that suggests, rather than spells out, the many ingredients that have slowly built a nation. A film without words.

results.title: Northanger Abbey
results.creator_credit: Giles Foster, Louis Marks and BBC
results.brief_description: This is Jane Austen’s classic story of Catherine Marland, a young girl whose head is stuffed full of romantic and melodramatic notions about the world. Through her adventures, she comes to learn that marriage in the society of her day is determined less by true love and more by mundane matters such as wealth and social status. The high point of the story comes when Catherine visits Northanger Abbey, the ancestral Gothic home of Henry Tilney - the young man she hopes to marry and believes loves her - and finds terrifying evidence that points to a dark secret involving the Tilney family. Rated: G

results.title: North to Wales
results.creator_credit: Michael Clarke, Ian Ferguson and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: This is a historical journey of Wales, a reminiscent perspective of the narrator’s life in Wales from a young lad to his return. We travel across Wales focusing on this beautiful and picturesque countryside full of wild country views to the ruined castles that protect its mountains.

results.title: North Pacific
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, Walford Hewitson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: It is an ocean of plenty, a vast aquatic pasture teeming with many species of fish and other marine life. Most sought is the salmon, but sometimes they do not “run.” This film shows extensive studies of the ocean to determine how temperatures, winds, currents, and plankton affect the sea harvest.

results.title: North of Vortex
results.creator_credit: Constantine Giannaris, Rebecca Dobbs and Western Connection
results.brief_description: This early work by Greek filmmaker Giannaris is an evocative road movie shot on location in striking black-and-white in New York and the wide open spaces of the American West. A gay poet from driving across the continent in his convertible picks up a bisexual sailor and a desperate waitress. Cool and leisurely-paced, the film explores the shifting (and occasionally explosive) emotional and power relationships between the three as they play out their romantic and sexual fantasies with one another. Cast: Stavros Zalmas, Howard Napper, Valda Drabla.

results.title: North Kimberley expedition
results.brief_description: An area of some 30,000 square miles in the North Kimberleys, Western Australia has not been settled. The film covers a survey expedition ot the great expanse of uninhabited country between Karunjie-Gibb River and Kalumburn Mission. Expedition leader: John F. Morgan.

results.title: North China factory
results.creator_credit: Boyce Richardson, Tony Ianzelo, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: North China Factory gives the audience a chance to see a factory community in China where over six thousand workers process, spin and weave raw cotton into ninety million yards of high-quality cloth per year. Also seen are the workers’ residential, social, recreational and educational facilities, all of which are located on factory property. Highlights of the film are the retirement and wedding ceremonies, in which factory management plays a major part. The film is an engrossing study of a lifestyle that is very different from that of the Western world.

results.title: North and south of the Niger
results.creator_credit: John Page and Taurus Film Productions
results.brief_description: Gives a picture of the various parts of Nigeria, and their peoples, and of Nigeria’s social problems. In the north, near the Sahara desert, the people are Mohammedans. In the central plateau live pagan peoples who herd cattle or practice a hoe agriculture. Near the coast, in the eastern provinces, live another pagan people, who get their living from the rain forests. In the western provinces, European influence is greatest. A Nigerian doctor living here explains some of Nigeria’s problems, especially in regard to health and food supply.
